data:
Persuader: Good afternoon, how is everything going?
	Persuadee: Great! How are you?
Persuader: I am doing relatively well and fine. 
	Persuadee: What kind of person are you?
Persuader: Well, I believe that overall I am good person with a great drive to do as much for people in general.  Many have said that I am a giving and kind person.
	Persuadee: What kind good things do you do for people?
Persuader: Well, I basically help individuals who are closest to me by helping the elderly with very tasks locally.  I also have a tendency to help children around my neighbor by mentoring some.  I also help with my local congregation by a Godly person as well.
	Persuadee: You sound like a very nice and charitable individual. It is a pleasure to meet you!
Persuader: Well, thank I appreciate your kindness.  I try to do right by people.  I believe in the golden rule do unto others as you have them do unto you.
	Persuadee: That is a very virtuous code to live by. I admire your morality.
Persuader: Thank you for your kindness.  I really appreciate your kind words.  It is nice to talk with you.  That brings me to one of the reasons why I am communicating with you today.
	Persuadee: I appreciate your kindness as well. What is your purpose? 
Persuader: Well, I believe in our children.  That is reason why I am a part of a cause to help children earth wide.  We are asking for any kind of monetary donation that you may have to help with the cause.
	Persuadee: I believe that helping children is a noble cause. How would my donation help these children? 
Persuader: Well, your donation would help on so many levels.  Your donation will help to the overall betterment, improved health, education, and safety of many of these children who come from a developing country.
	Persuadee: Why should I help these children? Are they not already being helped?
Persuader: Well, let me say this.  The children in these countries would like to have additional money provided because still in our modern day, it is still not enough to help.  That is one of the reasons why we are asking for more help.  There are many stories of children who have died from hunger but additional donations would be able to help to quell some of these isolated instances.
	Persuadee: That is very compelling. How much of a donation are you asking for?
Persuader: Well, any amount that you would like to offer would be greatly appreciated.  We like individuals to give from a joyful heart.  So whatever amount that you offer would be greatly appreciated and highly respected by our organization, the Save the Children fund.
	Persuadee: I have donated a lot this year to charity but I am able to spare $1 if it means helping children.

data:
Persuader: Hello, how are you today?
	Persuadee: Great! How are you? How is your weekend going?
Persuader: Not too bad. I'm excited to be volunteering my time to raise money for a children's charity. It's called Save the Children. 
	Persuadee: that's great that you volunteer. what kind of activities do you do for the children?
Persuader: Mostly what I do is try and encourage people to donate what they can to the cause. Save the Children has been around since 1919!  The funds are used to promote children's rights, better their education and health care and also provide emergency aid in situations of natural disaster. 
	Persuadee: do you know what countries they primarily donate to?
Persuader: Actually, there a huge number of countries that are helped by Save the Children. It's an international organization. Some of the countries include the U.S., Uganda, Kenya, Peru, and Cambodia. 
	Persuadee: that is great. i heavily support organizations that help our own united states.
Persuader: Did you know that, even one year after the destruction caused by hurricane Harvey, Save the Children is still present in Texas helping children to fully recover? It's truly a blessing what they do. Money also goes to provide shelter.  Just 77 cents a day can provide shelter for a refugee family. Do you think Save the Children is a cause that you would consider donating to?
	Persuadee: wow I'm heappy to hear that. It's wild the devastation that hurricanes do.
Persuader: In 2017, 155 million children were helped. There's always more to do though. How would you feel about helping Save the Children by donating some or all of your payment from this task?
	Persuadee: i would be willing to donate 10 cents. My charitable donations budget is small because I do a great deal of donating to animal organizations. I love the italian greyhound rescue.
Persuader: Even 10 cents is helpful. Thank you! That's great that you donate to animal charities. I support PAWS Chicago too. 
	Persuadee: the snamils need our help just as much as the children do. 
Persuader: No doubt! I just heard about a country does not kill rescue animals in shelters. So every shelter they run is a no-kill shelter. Have you heard that?
	Persuadee: i didn't know about that. great to hear it! hopefully more will do the same. I have a 5k to run tomorrow for the italian greyhounds. all proceeds go to the animals.
Persuader: Good for you! Wow, that's great!  It's nice when volunteers can act in other ways in addition to giving money. Especially since not everyone has the money to give. 
	Persuadee: right. I like to donate my time in addition to money. charitable giving is a good thing to do.
Persuader: Well thank you for offering 10 cents from this task to Save the Children. I will look into your charity as well and see what I can do to help. It's been nice talking with you. Have a great weekend and good luck with the run tomorrow!
	Persuadee: great, thanks. have a nice sunday!

Persuader: It appears to be comething called Save the Children.  I have no other information.

Persuader: The information is coming from the person who provided this hit.  They don't say who the money is going to.
	Persuadee: People aren't likely to donate to charities that they know nothing about.
Persuader: Good point.  I don't like children but perhaps you do.

Persuader: I found some more info:   Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.

Persuader: The address is  URL

	Persuadee: I won't be donating as part of this survey.

data:
Persuader: Hi there! How are you doing tonight?
	Persuadee: Fine, thanks!  You/
Persuader: I am doing pretty good, just relaxing for the night. What about you?
	Persuadee: Hanging out with family.  Doing some work.  Nothing exciting.
Persuader: Pretty much the same here. Spending a little time looking at the news. Do you read the news pretty regularly?
	Persuadee: I read it online, all the time every day!  I like to keep informed.  A lot of times I am reading from places that I don't necessarily agree with.  I find that more interesting!  Local or National news?
Persuader: Definitely both. I have really seen a lot about kids suffering lately. I am asking for donations to an organization called Save the Children. Have you heard of them?
	Persuadee: Maybe.  It's familiar.  Tell me about them.
Persuader: They area n organization that collects donations and then is able to use 90% of the donations to help kids attain basic needs like food, clothes and shelter. I am wondering if you would donate part of today's pay? Even a donation of $0.05 can help.
	Persuadee: Maybe.  It this a local, national?  where are they helping kids?
Persuader: It's both. They help kids in the US and other countries. Have you heard about the flooding in Hawaii?
	Persuadee: Of course.  I have a friend who has had to move in recent weeks.  .05 isn\'t going to help anyone much.  I\'ll donate 1.00 of the "pay" for today.
Persuader: Oh man. That is terrible. Pretty much the same day the news covered the flooding in Hawaii STC pledged to step in and help. I really respected the way they stepped up. Wow! you donation will really help a lot of kids. Are you interested in their website?
	Persuadee: No, not really, to be honest!  I'm glad to do a donation, but I'm involved in a lot of things in my own community.
Persuader: That is great that you help out in your community. What is your favorite thing to help with?
	Persuadee: Children's mental health, specifically assisting parents in having the information they need to assist their kids in getting and staying well.  I've been doing it for about five years.  
Persuader: That is so important. I used to work with kids with special needs. I loved it. Is it your job or volunteer work?
	Persuadee: My job is managing a program for employment for people with barriers to employment.  The children's mental health work is volunteer.  What kind of special needs?
Persuader: I worked with mostly kids that had physical disabilities. They were very young, 3-5 years old. Are the kids young, or older?
	Persuadee: Work is mostly young adults or older-  the volunteer work I do ranges from toddler to young adults.

data:
Persuader: Hi there, how are you?
	Persuadee: im good how about you?
Persuader: Have you ever heard of the causes, Save the Children?
	Persuadee: yes i have, i have donated quite a few times
Persuader: Just to remind you of the causes, Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
	Persuadee: would you be interested in donating money
Persuader: Of course I will be, but I think the situation here is that your role is the donator and mine is persuader?
	Persuadee: well could you tell me some of the benefits of donating
Persuader: Sure. As a matter of fact, the world has made great progress for children. More children are alive and thriving today than ever before. But here's the problem. Millions of children in the U.S. and around the world still aren't getting what they deserve. We're talking about children in need. Dying, when the world knows how to save them. Vulnerable children in poverty. Denied an education. Forced to flee violence. Orphaned, abused, abandoned. Children with no reason to smile. No hope for the future.  The world's children deserve better.
	Persuadee: is there any cons to donating
Persuader: For donor, there is no direct cons to donating. However, through the power of Sponsorship, you help ensure a child in need has the best chance for success _ with a healthy start, the opportunity to learn and protection from harm. Our innovative Sponsorship programs address the unique needs of children where they live.
	Persuadee: is there a minimum amount that i must donate 
Persuader: No, there isn't. It all depends on your generosity and financial ability. So would you like to donate?
	Persuadee: yes as a matter of fact i wish i could donate my whole life savings but that is not the case but i can donate  $0.25
Persuader: That is indeed very kind of you for making this donating decision. The cause and organization deeply thank you for your donation.
	Persuadee: you are so very welcome and i hope this will help at least a little bit
Persuader: Once again I would like to thank you for your donation and I assure you your donation will be used to help out those needy children.
	Persuadee: well i am thankful that we started talking otherwise i may have not been able to donate
Persuader: Alright then, you have a nice day ahead.
	Persuadee: i hope have a very great day!

data:
Persuader: Hello! Would you like to hear about Save The Children?
	Persuadee: What is it?
Persuader: It is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
	Persuadee: Sounds like a good organization
Persuader: I assure you that it is a wonderful organization! Your donation would be essential to help ensure children's rights to health, education, and safety. Your donation will make a tangible impact for the world.
	Persuadee: Is this the charity that they want us to donate?
Persuader: Yes, we would be ever so happy if you want to donate to this charity. Your donation would go to a very trustable fund.
	Persuadee: I would love to donate.
Persuader: Fantastic! What is an amount you are comfortable donating?
	Persuadee: Is this a mutual donation, from both of us.  Or do you represent the charity?
Persuader: I am representing the charity and I am hoping that you will consider donating directly from your task payment. You can choose any amount from $0 to $2. Of course, Your $2 would make the most difference to these neglected children.
	Persuadee: I am willing to donate $1.  That seems to be fair to all.
Persuader: Thank you so much for your generosity! The children of our organization will be so fortunate and happy to receive this. So many of these children are living in war zones in undeveloped countries. They face violence every day. 1,000 children were killed in the first 2 months of 2018. If you consider increasing your donation to $2, this will help DOUBLE the amount of children and our charity will match your donation at that level!
	Persuadee: I think I will stick to the $1.  That would make me happy to help.
Persuader: We are so happy that you are helping as well. The children will really benefit from this. Last year, many children died from hunger because we did not get enough donations to fully feed their families. Even small amounts of change can mean the difference between life or death for the little ones. Is there any way you could consider going to $1.50? I just spoke with my manager and wonderful news! She said the charity would STILL be willing to match if you go up just that small increment!
	Persuadee: I love helping the children.  If you would consider the matching that amount of the $1, that would double the donation of $2 .
Persuader: I will have to check with my manager. In the meantime, can I confirm your donation of $1 to our charity?
	Persuadee: Absolutely, I am glad to be able to participate for such a worthy cause.  Thank you so much.
Persuader: No, thank you for being such a compassionate person!
	Persuadee: You are more than welcome.

data:
Persuader: Hello!  Hope you are having a wonderful day.  Have you heard of the charity Save the Children?
	Persuadee: Yes, i am and I have heard of Save the Children.
Persuader: Would you ever consider donating any portion of your earnings from MTurk to a charity such as this?
	Persuadee: Yes, I have done that with different surveys and you?
Persuader: I think I would donate to a charity like this if given the chance.  I think it is important to help those less fortunate.  
	Persuadee: Always important especially one that involves children.  They are our future.
Persuader: Yes.  Saving the Children helps to ensure children's rights to health, education, safety, etc.  If people like us donate I wonder how much an impact it could make on the world around us?
	Persuadee: We make an impact even if it's to one child.
Persuader: Yes.  I have heard and read about countless stories of children dying from hunger all over, so even to help one child is a major impact.  Sounds like you are willing to donate to this cause?
	Persuadee: Always willing to donate to a good cause like this one.  Are you doing the collecting?
Persuader: Not personally, but I just like to talk to people about the greater good.  I know in America we are blessed and it is good to help those who can't help themselves.  I like you work this job to make money, but occasionally donate when I can.  Obviously, I can't do it every time, but a small donation every once in a while helps.
	Persuadee: It does help. I usually volunteer because I have more time to spend than money and volunteers are need everywhere.
Persuader: That is true.  I sometimes struggle with the time issue since having a family, so donations like this help me feel like I am making an impact.  I think it would be helpful for this cause if we donated to this charity.  Here is the link to their website if you want to find out more about what they do  URL 
	Persuadee: Okay thanks for website. I am sure we can donate money there.  I like that the survey gives us a chance to donate part of our pay.
Persuader: How much do you plan to donate from $0 to $2?  The research team will collect all donations and send it to Save the Children.
	Persuadee: I have decided on half so that's $1 and you?  Are you donating any today?
Persuader: I will probably donate as well, but haven't decided on the exact amount.  I don't mean to be vague, but just need to think about it some more.
	Persuadee: okay, I am retired and don't have extra money to give so it's good to do this way.
Persuader: That is very generous of you.  I agree this is a good way to do this.  Hope you are enjoying your retirement.  You have been very easy to chat with.  I am thankful there are people like you in the world to help with charities.  I think Save the Children is a good cause to help so many in need.
	Persuadee: Yes, I think it's a good cause and they make it easy for us to donate this way.

Persuader: Hi, I hope you are well today!
	Persuadee: I am how are you doing?  
Persuader: Great! I'm getting ready to spend the day volunteering for my favorite charity!
	Persuadee: Yes, so I think it is a good idea to donate to the childrens charity.

	Persuadee: No I am not. Can you tell me about it?
Persuader: They promote children's rights and help support kids in developing countries. It takes so little money to help feed a starving child.
	Persuadee: What can I do to help?
Persuader: I'm so glad you asked! One thing you could do is agree to contribute what you make just from this one task we are doing right now. 
	Persuadee: Ok how much do you need?
Persuader: If you pledge to contribute the reward from this task, that will feed a starving child for a full day! Isn't that amazing? 
	Persuadee: That is awesome but I need the money so I can't afford to give right now.
Persuader: I know what you mean, I need to make money too. But at the same time, here we are in front of our computers, and we can work all day to make up the small amount we will contribute. 
	Persuadee: I can't work all day.  I have to take care of my disable family member and I really can't afford it.
Persuader: Oh I'm so sorry to hear that. I have problems too. But as little as $1 can feed a child for the whole day. I don't know about you, but I could find $1 in change just lying around the house. No matter how big our problems are, we are not going to starve for lack of a dollar...

Persuader: That's awesome and generous! Thank you for doing this. I will also give money today. Believe it or not, 10 cents makes a difference in a child's life!

Persuader: Thank you again. If you would like to learn more about Save the Children, check out their website. Have an awesome day and thank you again!

Persuader: The web address is  URL

data:
Persuader: Hi! How are you today?
	Persuadee: hey there! How's it going with you?
Persuader: Great thank you! Hope your day has been great so far. 
	Persuadee: It's not too bad just yet. I just got in to work so we will see how things go today!
Persuader: Hopefully it will be a good day :) Do you mind if I ask what kind of work you do?
	Persuadee: I actually work for a local television station in the middle of America.
Persuader: Oh wow that sounds fantastic! Were you ever involved in raising awareness about social issues? Like children in need?
	Persuadee: I've donated to a few charities before, but I've never been personally involved myself.
Persuader: I think you have a great platform for raising awareness so more people can donate to the cause
	Persuadee: That's true. I supposed I am in a good position. Unfortunately, I kind of just have a desk job, and don't really have anything to do with the news that is broadcast.
Persuader: Well nothing is lost there, you can maybe persuade some co-workers to bring it up higher in the chain. A few years back I was in India and even though I was mesmerized by the beauty of its rich culture I was overly sad to see many children in the streets who looked utterly malnutritioned and were begging in the streets. It broke my heart. So much so that I got involved with a few charities to help children around the world.
	Persuadee: Oh that's great!! I wish I had more time to travel and more money to give. I love the feeling when you know you're actually helping someone else.
Persuader: Its a great feeling. Especially now that I myself am a parent, I get even more depressed to see that in 2018, there are millions of children who suffer especially those in war zones. But you know, every little cent helps. You don't have to give hundreds or thousands. I have also worked in Baghdad during the war, and there were children in the streets selling packs of gum just to get a few cents here and there so they can survive.
	Persuadee: Oh my God. That's truly awful to know that children have to experience that. I would love to find a way to donate, even if it was just a little bit.
Persuader: Have you heard of "Save the Children" Charity? They do amazing wo? It only takes 77c a day to help provide shelter for refugees. They have many programs that you can participate in to help out.  
	Persuadee: Oh that's awesome!! What kind of programs do they provide?
Persuader: They target many causes. They provide education to teach children important skills. They also provide the best health and nutrition programs. They have a protection program and even programs for natural disaster areas. Imagine if 77c a day can provide shelter what would $1 or $2 dollars do?
	Persuadee: That's such a good point. Unfortunately, I'm in a really bad position monetarily right now. Is there any way I could donate even just a little bit?
Persuader: You are very kind, but like I said every little thing helps. How much would you feel comfortable to donate to the charity?
	Persuadee: Maybe 20 cents? I know that's not a lot, but it's all I can afford for the next couple days.
Persuader: Can you make it maybe 77c? Atleast you will feel good knowing that you are helping in providing shelter to these poor refugees.Your donation will be direclt deducted from your task payment but imagine what 77c would do for a child with no home...
	Persuadee: OK, I can donate 77 ceents
Persuader: Perfect!!!!!! Thank you so so much! Imagine what a great gift you have just provided. May you be blessed always! And I hope, one day you will be able to raise awareness and have more people join in with the cause to save the children. Have a great day!!!

data:
Persuader: Hello. Have you heard about Save the Children?
	Persuadee: A little bit would like to know more.
Persuader: Save the Children is a non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights and helps provide support for needy children in developing countries around the world.
	Persuadee: Oh I see. How many people around the world help this organization?
Persuader: Last year, Save the Children helped to provide education, food, shelter, and other basic necessities for more than 155 million children worldwide.
	Persuadee: Wow, that is amazing! 
Persuader: I'm sure you are aware that throughout the world there are millions of children who lack access to basic needs like food, clean water, good clothing, and education. Save the Children works to help those kids, so that they can grow up to be healthy, happy, and productive adults.
	Persuadee: Yes, I am aware. Its truly sad that children are suffering like that. I am truly thankful for organizations like Save the Children are around to help these children out and bless families! 
Persuader: I'm also glad that organizations like Save the Children are out there making a difference. As I'm sure you also know, Save the Children is reliant on donations to be able to provide the help they do.
	Persuadee: Yes, I know. I often get asked to help out different organizations when checking out at grocery stores and majority of the time I do!
Persuader: That's great! I'd like you to know that if you choose to donate to Save the Children, they are a top-rated charity. Last year, 86% of all donated funds went directly into programs to help needy children. 
	Persuadee: Glad to hear they are top rated! What happens to the other percentage that does not go to the program?
Persuader: About 5% goes to administration costs, while about 9% is spent on fundraising efforts. 
	Persuadee: That makes sense. Fundraising is definitely important in getting the word out so that money can be raised for the children.
Persuader: Would you be willing to make a small donation today? Every little bit helps, and even a donation as small as $1 can go a long way to help in some of the areas where Save the Children provides aid.
	Persuadee: I would definitely love to help. Could I do anything under $1.00 like maybe 50 cents? 
Persuader: Of course! Donations in any amount are welcome.
	Persuadee: Great! I would love to donate 50 cents. I wish I had more but unfortunately I dont at this time. 
Persuader: I understand. But I really appreciate you donating what you can afford. As I said before, every little bit helps.
	Persuadee: Awesome! I am glad that I can at least do something to help out. 
Persuader: Thank you again for your kind donation.
	Persuadee: Not a problem. Have a blessed night.

data:
Persuader: Hello how are you doing today?
	Persuadee: I am doing just fine. How about you?
Persuader: I am doing wonderful thank you for asking. Where you are from? I'm originally from Maine.
	Persuadee: I am currently living in Florida but I grew up in upstate New York.
Persuader: I've always wanted to visit Florida. I love helping out with various charities and the like, are there any good charities in Florida that you are involved in?
	Persuadee: There are few but I am not heavily involved  with them.
Persuader: That's good that there are some. I like to get involved becaue I like to feel like I might be helping out in some way. I love helping out with animal groups and groups that help out disadvantaged children. Have you ever heard of the Save the Children organization? Would you ever consider donating to a charity like that?
	Persuadee: I have heard of that group but I have never really thought about donating to it.
Persuader: They're a great group, they're an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries. I like to donate a little bit to them from time to time, not much mind you, I don't really have or make a lot of money, but it's nice knowing I can contribute at least a little something. Anything that can help. Sometimes it can really brighten my day knowing I might have helped someone. Would you consider making a small donation from a portion of the HIT completion compensation, something as little as .10 cents?
	Persuadee: Yes, I can make a small donation. I will do $0.20.
Persuader: That would be awesome! Anything from $0.10, $0.20, $2.00... anything would make a difference with this wonderful organization. Every contribution counts. You're helping make a difference in a child's life an helping to end suffering. Thank you for your generosity!
	Persuadee: Glad to donate the charity
Persuader: I will match your donation of $0.20, making it a donation of $0.40, that way it mill go further. It's always great to help out when you can. Thank you again for your pledge of $0.20, it is greatly appreciated.
	Persuadee: Your welcome, have you been a MTurker for a while? 
Persuader: I have, I have been one for about 2 years now. I come on every once and a while and do it part time. I like to call it picking up nickels and dimes. How about yourself?
	Persuadee: I have been doing it since January. I find some these HITs very interesting.
Persuader: Yeah, they can be really fun and fascinating. I ike doing some of theses surveys then hearing the results later on, passively, since I don\'t really know at the time of doing them what they\'re for really. It\'s fun to say, "Hey, I participated in that study"
	Persuadee: Yeah I like doing the Product review type HITs and the ones where you have to watch a video  
Persuader: Those are pretty good. My favorite one so far has been recording my voice saying various words for a study on accents in speech. Then hearing the results on a news story about 6 months later... pretty satisfying.
	Persuadee: That sounds interesting. I try to do between 5 and 10 hits a day.
Persuader: Coll talking to you, thanks for doing this hit with me today. It was awesome!
	Persuadee: Your welcome, maybe will do this again on some other HIT

Persuader: Hello, how are you doing today, may I ask if you are a charitable person?
	Persuadee: I'm well thanks, how are you? Depending on the situation, I try to be.
Persuader: I am doing fine, I just ask in case you would like to donate to a nonprofit organization called Save The Children
	Persuadee: What exactly does the organization do?
Persuader: It helps the children all around the world, whether they are poor o not
	Persuadee: Yes, but how does the organization help the children? Specifically?
Persuader: Builds schools, gets them scholarships, builds orphanages, educates them, provides them with food and shelter, all kinds of things
	Persuadee: How does the organization determine which children they will help?
Persuader: They try to help every kid they can, so, they operate all around the world
	Persuadee: Yes, but how do they identify chlidren to help? 
Persuader: They mostly look around UNICEF reports and other Human Rights Organizations
	Persuadee: Is there already an infrastructure if they want to approach a new village?
Persuader: They usually approach first by trying to get on the good side of the villagers, helping them with what they need, they only build infrastructure after they have gotten their permission, that way they don't intromise with their customs or rules
	Persuadee: What do you mean by intromise?
Persuader: Sometimes the villagers think that the organization volunteers are trying to change their customs or force them to accept something
	Persuadee: Sorry, I didn't recognize that word.
Persuader: So, would you like to donate to this organization?
	Persuadee: Sorry, I just don't think that I know enough about what exactly they do.
Persuader: Well, they pretty much help children, that's what they do, they try to give them a brighter future and give them the tools to progress instead of doing everything for them 
	Persuadee: But, for example, you can build a school, but if you don't enable the village to build, support, and potentiate a staff, it doesn't really do them any good.

data:
Persuader: Hi, have you ever heard of the charity "Save the Children" before?
	Persuadee: No I havent, please tell me more.
Persuader: Save the Children is a charity organization that provides funding to help get children access to health and education all over the world  
	Persuadee: That sounds great.  I think any childrens charity that is legitimate is worthy.  I am a big fan of St Jude's, I like the fact that they treat children but are also looking for a cure for diseases.
Persuader: Yeah St Jude's is a great organization that helps find cures for diseases.  There are a lot of other emergencies out there besides disease though, like disasters caused by weather or conflict and Save The Children provides money to help kids affected by that
	Persuadee: So the organization just funds local clinics but does not have any personal effect on treating children?
Persuader: Save the Children definitely has an effect on treating kids, they are active in over 120 countries and as well as providing funding to local organizations they also give direct aid like emergency supplies after a disaster. So they really can do it either way.  
	Persuadee: I feel so silly! Is "Save the Children" that organization that I see commercials for that shows sad underweight children with swollen tummies and says for the price of a cup of coffee each day you can sponsor a child.  Those are heartwrenching
Persuader: Yeah those commercials can be persuasive, there are so many different disasters affecting kids all over the world. The food insecurity in Africa is off the charts whenever there is a drought and Save the Children helps provide food to starving kids there. Any donation can really help provide more food.
	Persuadee: Thats wonderful, I definitely support helping those children.  I guess I dont think too much about them day to day, I kind of get consumed by the homelessness here in my city, or what our local church is funding at the moment.  But starving children deserve more wherever they are.  Its sad that we can never do enough
Persuader: Yeah its hard because wll live in such a connected world that you hear about so many awful things going on. On the positive side though in the past all of these awful things were happening but there were less mechanisms to help stop it. But for example this week thousands were displaced in Somali because of flooding but now Save the Children along with other organizations will go over there to help them.
	Persuadee: Thats great, what is their website so I can look more into it?
Persuader:  URL here you go
	Persuadee: Thank you! Do you also sponsor children yourself?
Persuader: I have but not directly with Save the Children, I have been active in other organizations though like Boys and Girls Club
	Persuadee: oh, thats a great organization also.  I always wondered if the kids really write letters, that would be really neat.
Persuader: Some do, but the sponsorship isn't just for a specific child it just goes into a fund. The kids write letters to people who put money into the fund. That allows them greater flexibility to move money around to where its needed
	Persuadee: Oh ok, well thats a shame.  But I am not discounting the cause.
Persuader: I think it really is more of a positive because if someone was to donate but later on in life they had to pause their donation for a time for some reason or another they wouldn't feel morally responsible for that child no longer being supported, because their would be other donors in the fund that would pick up the slack. 
	Persuadee: That makes a lot of sense. Thank you for sharing this with me, I will definitely look more into this charity!
Persuader: Great happy to help! Thanks for a nice conversation

data:
Persuader: Hey! How are you?
	Persuadee: I am fine, and you?
Persuader: Doing really well. I was curious if you have any particular charities that you admire or donate to.
	Persuadee: No none in particular
Persuader: I've got a couple that I am interested in but sometimes I wonder if the money goes where they say, you know?
	Persuadee: Yea that is exactly how I feel as well, I like helping out but I dont want it to be in vain
Persuader: I did a survey on here a while back that laid out a couple charities really thoroughly and then offered to let me give up some of my "reward" for the survey to the charity. I thought it was an interesting idea. Plus sometimes I\'m just lazy and that\'s an easy uncomplicated way to do it.
	Persuadee: Yes, i do like that concept. However, I often wonder what a big difference it would really make
Persuader: Remember that ice bucket challenge thing that was super popular a while back? I thought it was fun but wouldn't do anything productive. Turns out they raised so much money it some drug trial through and they've found a drug that helps and is now on the market and that just blew me away. Downside of course is people still have to part with money they already had. I donated some of my reward to the charity because it wasn't really out of my pocket and I guess I figured every little bit might help.
	Persuadee: Oh wow, I never knew that! That is amazing what a difference we can make without thinking it would really make one
Persuader: I know and besides it got my son to dump a bucket of ice water on himself which was just hilarious.
	Persuadee: That is funny! Honestly, before the challenge I never even heard about ALS, so I guess it did its job by spreading awareness
Persuader: That's really true. Maybe on top of people not wanting the rigamarole of the donation process sometimes all we need is a better understanding of the need or just faith that a little from everyone can go a long way. 
	Persuadee: Yea, maybe more challenges can be done to spread awareness to diseases that often go unnoticed or unheard of
Persuader: Yeah, maybe, people just need information, ease of donating, and a sense of community about it all. This HIT we are doing is kind of doing the same thing as that other survey I did. We both get our base pay and then can choose to keep the added incentive or donate a portion of it to the charity Save the Children. I was contemplating giving some of mine away. I've worked overseas with kids through medical clinics and have seen how far what we think of as a small amount of money can really go.
	Persuadee: Yes, I am willing to donate a portion to the charity
Persuader: I was going to donate half of mine. Some for me for the work and some for them in the hopes it helps.  How much would you like to donate to Save the Children out of the payment?
	Persuadee: Yes I would like to donate .75 towards the foundation
Persuader: Brilliant. That's so kind of you. Between us both I hope it helps. And I love that they are giving their money to something other than profit, you know?
	Persuadee: Yes! Hope it helps the children in some type of way

data:
Persuader: Hi, how are you today?
	Persuadee: okay..and how are you
Persuader: I'm doing great. Out of curiousity, have you heard of the organization Save the Children?
	Persuadee: yes..i am very familiar..are you involved with charity
Persuader: Yes! I really prefer local charities but some nationwide and international ones are very dear to my heart. Whenever we have the opportunity to donate from our task rewards I always try to give a little bit.
	Persuadee: me too..i see many commercials for charity on TV and it breaks my heart.. i am also a follower of Unicef, are you familiar
Persuader: Yes, I've heard of Unicef. Another great organization. One thing I love about Save the Children is that they have very high ratings from third-party reportings. I know when I donate to them that my money is being used wisely!
	Persuadee: interesting, what do the ratings represent
Persuader: The ratings are from different companies such as Better Business Bureau and American Institute of Philanthropy. They actually get the financial reports from the IRS to confirm the accuracy in where the funds are going.
	Persuadee: very good...are you interested in other charities involved with children
Persuader: I have given to other organizations in the past, such as World Vision, but Save the Children is really important to me right now. There is such a lack of support right now in developing countries, and Save the Children really focuses on that.
	Persuadee: i happen to favor unicef since my kids collect for halloween and kids count monies as part of class project.
Persuader: I totally understand that. One thing I like about Save the Children is that it isn't just global but also focuses on kids in need here in the USA, especially the poverty-torn cities.
	Persuadee: i tend to give up to 100$ a month to children's org- what is your prefered donation?
Persuader: I typically give less than that, because I also give to my local church and other local organizations in my city.
	Persuadee: ah..what do you consider a fair donation per month
Persuader: Well, I just usually give $20 or $30 to a handful of charities that I love. But like I said, if the opportunity arises for me to donate some of my HIT reward to a charity, I will usually donate at least a small portion. Do you ever do that?
	Persuadee: i tend to give to people on the street asking for $$..there lots of opp...20 to 30 is fair amount
Persuader: You actually have the opportunity today to donate a portion of your task payment to Save the Children. How much would you like to put towards that? It can be any amount from just $0.10 to the full payment!
	Persuadee: hmm..interesting i will consider that..how would i contact them
Persuader: The research team will collect all donations and send it directly to Save the Children. You can just type the amount here you'd like to donate and it will be recorded for them to see.
	Persuadee: ty..i will contact and agree to start off with 10$ per month
Persuader: Thank you! Have a great day!

data:
Persuader: Hi there. Have you heard about Save the Children? It is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries
	Persuadee: Yes I have heard of this organization.  
Persuader: Fantastic! Have you made a donation to them previously?
	Persuadee: No I haven't.  I have made donations to other children's charities though.
Persuader: Would you care to donate $1? A donation would help ensure children's rights to health, education, safety, etc.
	Persuadee: I would be happy to donate $1.  I think it's a good cause. I'd like to hear more about some specific projects but I'll donate anyway.
Persuader: Wonderful! I'd be happy to share more information with you. Do you have any specific questions?
	Persuadee: What countries do they work in primarily?
Persuader: Great question! Save the Children works worldwide but primarily provides support in developing countries, especially in war zones.
	Persuadee: Do they work with refugees?  
Persuader: Yes, working with refugees is one of Save the Children's many priorities!
	Persuadee: How much of the donations they receive go to the work on the ground vs overhead costs, do you know?
Persuader: Good question. In fiscal year 2017, 86% of all expenditures went to program services.
	Persuadee: Oh wow!  That's quite good.  Do they train local staff or send people in?
Persuader: Yes! Only 14% is spent on management and fundraising. As far as staff, we have global advocates who provide services but also make sure to provide local staff that is familiar with the locations needs.
	Persuadee: Do people who make donations get info on the specific project their money went to or any type of update like that?
Persuader: Absolutely! We want to be completely transparent. Save the Children has long-standing credentials and international impact.
	Persuadee: Where is the organization based out of?
Persuader: We are in Fairfield, CT!
	Persuadee: approximately how many kids were helped last year?

Persuader: Hello. Have you ever heard of the organization Save the Children?

Persuader: They are an amazing organization with a national and an international presence. Would you like to know more about what they do?
	Persuadee: I think I'm okay. No need to share more information
Persuader: I understand and I do not want to take up too much of your time. But please know that this organization ehlps children on every continent but Antartica. 
	Persuadee: Why not Antartica?
Persuader: There just isn't the population to warrant it. The climate is not sustainable for human life and children do not reside there. But in the other countries they provide emergency response, global advocacy,  literacy, and health education. 
	Persuadee: Well that's disappointing. What country receives the most aid?
Persuader: It is spread out by need but rest assured that their charity ranges from Kentucky all the way to Kenya. Also, 86% of all expenditures go to program services so everyone that donates knows that their money is being used for a good cause rather than misappropriated.

	Persuadee: Sounds like a good mission, but I probably won't be able to donate

	Persuadee: No thanks. I like to keep my money for now.
Persuader: I understand. You have a good day.

data:
Persuader: Hello
	Persuadee: hello there
Persuader: I am here on behalf of an organization called Save the Children have you heard of them before?
	Persuadee: It sounds faintly familiar, but I can't recall exactly. What do they do?
Persuader: We are a charity that specializes in ensuring the health, safety and education for children around the world.  We specialize in providing aid to children in war torn countries.  Would you be interested in making a donation?
	Persuadee: That's admirable, but I wouldn't be interested in making a donation at this time,
Persuader: I completely understand.  It wouldn't be much.  Every little bit counts.  In the first two months of this year alone 1000 children were killed or injured due to violence in developing nations.  All were asking for is a $2 donation to ensure that children affected can get access to the resources they need to live a healthy and prosperous life.
	Persuadee: Sorry, but no. That sucks for them and everything, but I have like 4 cents in my bank account so every little bit counts for me right now too
Persuader: These children live on less than that every month.  Its less than the cost of a cup of coffee at your local Starbucks. Think about it, for just $2 you can bring security to a child in war torn Syria.  Im sure you could find $2 in your couch cushions.
	Persuadee: i don't even have a couch honestly. I can't donate.
Persuader: And neither do these children. We arent asking for much.  Anything you can spare will benefit the children. We would gladly accept a modest donation of $1.  What do you say, could you spare even a single dollar to help these kids?
	Persuadee: No I can not
Persuader: I understand the apprehension.  I know times can be tough for us here as well.  These children do not know when they will eat next.  They struggle to find a place to sleep.  Many have lost parents due to violence and are faced with conditions that we could not even imagine here.  Its just one dollar.  Are you sure you cant spare a single dollar?
	Persuadee: That sucks. I sympathize but I can not. 
Persuader: Not even 75 cents.  We will take any donation possible.  Like I said any small amount helps.
	Persuadee: no im sorry
Persuader: You cant spare 75 cents for a starving child?
	Persuadee: no i can not
Persuader: Is there any amount you would be willing to donate?
	Persuadee: no i won't be donating today
Persuader: I really encourage you to open your wallet.

data:
Persuader: Have you heard of Save The Children, a charity to help children across the world?
	Persuadee: I haven't heard of this charity. What is it all about?
Persuader: It's a UK based organization that helps aid children from poor countries. Today I'm talking to you on behalf of those children.
	Persuadee: How do you help these kids?
Persuader: We take donations of any type from generous men and women. Today, there are children in Syria who are going through a war they had no choice in. They need help.
	Persuadee: Is there an opportunity to volunteer?
Persuader: Of course! If you're in the area... But I will be talking to you about donating today if you'd be so willing. You can choose to donate any amount you wish. It will be taken straight from your earnings on this task. As little as one cent, or as much as the entire thing. 
	Persuadee: I'm always concerned that the money doesn't actually get to where it is needed.
Persuader: What concerns specfically do you have about where you believe it is going?
	Persuadee: I think a lot of it is used for administrative fees and overhead.
Persuader: Those adrministrative fees and overhead costs are part of the foundation that is laid to be able to put the additional money to good use. You can't start spending on buying food, putting up shelter, and giving kids what they need without starting with the base. There are children across the world right now who need school supplies for education that we take for granted with it starting up again soon! 
	Persuadee: So what percentage of the donations actually goes to the kids?
Persuader: There is an inital upfront cost of building the base for our organization in a location, and then the majority of costs are aimed towards helping the kids in that area. I don't have an exact percentage. The main idea here is that you're willing to help people who are in need. I urge you to consider donating a part of your reward for this HIT towards Save The Children.
	Persuadee: I can donate 20 cents.
Persuader: You would be helping out a great deal. That goes a long way in many countries. Thank you very much.
	Persuadee: happy to help
Persuader: So right now there is a 10 year old girl in Vietnam who has been waiting 109 days for a donation. There is also a 3 year old girl in Haiti who has been waiting 64. Which of these two would you prefer to help?
	Persuadee: The one who has been waiting the longest.
Persuader: Alright, Dam will be excited to learn about your gift. Parents in her country earn an average of $5 a day, and this could help pay for an entire meal.
	Persuadee: Once again, happy to help.

Persuader: Yes, Save the Children is rated A
	Persuadee: That is good. That means a large part of the donations go to the cause. 
Persuader: Yes, the breakdown that they advertise on their website also spells out where the funds go which is helpful. I'm very cautious when it comes to donating because I don't want my money misused.
	Persuadee: I feel the same way. If to much money is going to the administrators that is not good. 
Persuader: Yes, sort of defeats the purpose in my opinion. So are there any other questions I could answer for you before you decide how much you'd like to donate?
	Persuadee: Where does the money go? What countries?
Persuader: So right now the organization is in 120 countries, which is pretty incredible. It goes to many many things, such as, shelter for refugee families, healthcare - funding hospitals and programs, education - funding schools and programs, food/shelter options...
	Persuadee: Alright, that is a lot of help for children. What comes next? How much do people donate?
Persuader: So people donate anywhere from just a few cents to as much as they possibly can given the fact that the money is well used. To give you an idea, 77 cents a day can provide shelter for a refugee family. 
	Persuadee: Alright, I can donate 77 cents. 
Persuader: Thank you! Every little bit counts!
	Persuadee: Is there anything we have to talk about? This is the first time I have done this chat?
Persuader: No, I believe we can wrap it up now if you don't have any more questions!
	Persuadee: I do not thank you!
Persuader: Thank you! Have a great day!

Persuader: Hi, I'd like to talk to you about Save the Children.
	Persuadee: Okay, what is Save the Children
Persuader: It is an organization that helps children in difficult life situations.
	Persuadee: How does it help the children?
Persuader: It promotes their rights. It provides medical care and food.
	Persuadee: What kind of difficult life situations are the children in?
Persuader: They live in poor countries. Governments are corrupt. These kids need help!
	Persuadee: How is the medical care and food dispensed?
Persuader: We send in volunteers under the guard of military people. Nurses and doctors from other countries set up clinics.
	Persuadee: How does this charity promote their rights?
Persuader: They work with international legal agencies to file court cases locally and to petition govt for new laws.
	Persuadee: How does the charity decide what countries to help?
Persuader: The UN lists countries in which children have it worst. StC starts with the hardest-hit places and works with neighboring govts.
	Persuadee: Okay. Is this a non profit?
Persuader: Yes, it is nonprofit. There are few orgs like us, and we could use all the help we can get.
	Persuadee: Do you accept volunteers?
Persuader: We do, but it is hard to qualify because of the difficult conditions. We only accept the best. 
	Persuadee: That is understandable. What is the process for becoming a volunteer?
Persuader: At this stage, we are in greater need of funding to support current operations.
	Persuadee: That makes sense. Thank you for the information!

data:
Persuader: Hello, have you heard of Save The Children?
	Persuadee: I think so, it sounds familiar. it is a nonprofit charity if i recall. What exactly do they do?
Persuader: Save The Children helps kids from around the world by taking contributions from generous patrons. Kids from countries that have been stricken by poverty, violence, and other blights.
	Persuadee: What countries has the charity worked in recently? 
Persuader: Well, we have programs set up in 120 countries in total right now. Some of our most recent campaigns involve Myanmar - in Rohingya where parents and their children have been forced to flee because of violence to surrounding countries. In the largest refugee camp stationed in Bangladesh, there are an estimated 915,000 children and adults taking shelter.
	Persuadee: Wow that sounds like a really robust program. How long has Save the Children been around?
Persuader: It was founded in 1919, on April 15th in London - UK.
	Persuadee: Do you work for Save the Children or do you just volunteer for the charity?
Persuader: I do not work for them, I work on behalf of them. That is why I'm talking to you today. These children need help, and could use it from generous people like you. A meal, an education, an opportunity like everyone else, that is all these kids want. Even one cent will add up to help a child in need, but if you wish you may donate up to 2 dollars. For every cent you donate it will come directly from your task payment.
	Persuadee: I love to help charities that serve a good cause and I would love to donate but I do have one question. What is the portion of donations that goes to children versus the portion that goes to administration or other expenses
Persuader: Sure, absolutely. In 2017, 86% went to Program services - or services that directly help aid these children. 9% went towards fundraising efforts, and 5% went towards our Management & other general costs. In 2018 we anticipate similar numbers.
	Persuadee: That's pretty impressive! Not too many charities can claim such a strong commitment to the cause.
Persuader: We do it for them, not for ourselves. And we hope our numbers reflect that amount of love and effort that goes toward what we do.
	Persuadee: I'd be willing to donate $1 to Save the Children.
Persuader: That is very kind! After this chat is complete, you may choose how ever much you wish to give on the next page. Would you like to know about a potential child this money would be helping?
	Persuadee: Sure, tell me more about a potential child this money would help.
Persuader: Mim, in Bangladesh is 7 years old, and wants to become a teacher. It could go towards her education, because in her country the average girl only stays in school until 10 years old. But more likely, it will be going towards meals or daily living expenses, with the average parent from her country only earning $3 a day.
	Persuadee: How much does a $1 dollar donation change a child like Mim's situation?
Persuader: As you can see, $1 will change their world. One more meal or a pair of shoes will be one less thing that Mim, and her parents need to worry about. Bangladesh has been one of the largest parts of that Rohingya refugee exodus from Myanmar that I mentioned before and have been struggling themselves taking on more than 655,000 extra people. This has caused further hardship on an already hardened country.
	Persuadee: Besides donating and raising awareness, is there any other way I can help Save the Children?
Persuader: Yes. You can slo sign up & stay connected on our website with your email and phone number. You can also volunteer if you're in the area of any of these children at our program centers. Thank you for donation, there will never be enough people like you in the world!

Persuader: Hi. I'm MJ. Have you heard of Save the Children?
	Persuadee: I believe I have, yes.
Persuader: It's a charity that directly benefits kids in terms of education, food, etc., especially in war-torn countries. I was hoping I could interest you in donating a portion of your payment today toward it.
	Persuadee: I could donate $1.
Persuader: That would be really generous.  I plan to donate $1 too.
	Persuadee: Great. What are some recent successes the charity has had?
Persuader: You know. I'd have to look that up to get specifics, but give me a sec and I'll go look. Where are you from?
	Persuadee: I'm in Chicago
Persuader: Ah, the windy city. I'm in Midvale, Utah.
	Persuadee: Pretty cool. I've never been to Utah.
Persuader: We've got some beautiful national parks here. Lots of crazy rock formations.
	Persuadee: Yeah I've seen pictures of them. A lot of my friends have done the whole touring the parks out west trip; I just haven't yet.
Persuader: I hope you do some day. Right now, Save the Children is working with Rohingya Refugees and Hurricane Harvey victims among other things (didn't want you to think I forgot your question)
	Persuadee: No that's cool. It's good to hear about things being done about the Rohingya situation.
Persuader: We only have a couple of seconds left. I just wanted to say that it was nice to chat with you.
	Persuadee: Nice chatting with you too!
Persuader: Ready for fall in  Chicago? What's the weather like there?
	Persuadee: It's been humid but we've got a huge thunderstorm going right now. Hopefully it will break the heat.
Persuader: Would love a good thunderstorm. Very dry here.  Take care, my friend.
	Persuadee: You take care too!

data:
Persuader: Hello
	Persuadee: Yea, hello. Glad you took your time.
Persuader: I'd like to speak to you about Save the Children. Do you have any kids?
	Persuadee: No, I do not have kids. What is Save the Children about?
Persuader: Save the Children is an international non-governemnt organization. Their goal is to promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
	Persuadee: That sounds really cool. What specific countries do they help out?
Persuader: They help out many third world countries from all over the world.
	Persuadee: Okay. I guess I would look them up sometime to find out more.
Persuader: How do you feel about those who were unluckily born to poor circumstances?
	Persuadee: I feel like it's a shame and I wish we could do more. How can I help?
Persuader: You sound like a really kind person. Would you like to make a donation to Save the Children. Anything will help.
	Persuadee: Thank you, I would like to make a 50 dollar donation but first. Is there a website for this charity?
Persuader: Thank you! That will make a difference in many of their lives. Yes. There is.  URL 
	Persuadee: IT looks really good and professional. I am definitely going to donate.
Persuader: Thank you. It will be appreciated it.
	Persuadee: Is there any other information you can share with me that I shuld know about?
Persuader: Absolutely. Recently, we will have been involved in the US-Mexico border crisis involved with separating children from their parents at the border.
	Persuadee: That sounds awesome. I wish you all luck in that. 
Persuader: Thank you. It will be difficult, but we are focused in reuniting the children with their family. The separation should never have happened.
	Persuadee: I definitely agree with that. It takes a lot to fix this country already so your effort is definitely astounding.
